image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: A new economic report commissioned by the Hobart City Council has found the stadium will deliver more than $140 million in economic impact to Hobart per year during the construction phase, and $178 million when operational.

title.children: Hobart will reap 'significant' economic benefits from stadium, report says

image.altText: A closeup of hands securing a round red pipe cutter onto a copper pipe.

props.synopsis: Copper thieves are suspected of targeting vacant homes using real estate websites, leaving real estate agents and plumbers to clean up the mess and owners to foot the bill.

title.children: Have an empty property? Thieves may be eyeing it for its copper

image.altText: Woman holding plastic bottle near donation site

props.synopsis: A long-awaited Tasmanian container deposit scheme which promotes recycling will leave beverage retailers "no choice" but to pass on the cost to consumers, an industry representative says.

title.children: Get ready to pay more for drinks after Tasmanian scheme begins

image.altText: A coffin, seen through the screen on a smart phone

props.synopsis: A Vatican official tells the ABC that taking pictures of, or with, the deceased pontiff is "frowned upon", as people snapping selfies becomes a phenomenon inside St Peter's Basilica.

title.children: Vatican responds as crowds take 'creepy' selfies with pope's body

image.altText: A group of police officers walking down a road securing a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A French high school student has killed one of his classmates and wounded three others, the latest in a spate of school incidents in the European country.

title.children: Macron hails 'courage' of teachers after deadly France school stabbing

image.altText: Michaelia Cash speaks at a press conference with Sussan Ley behind her

props.synopsis: A Nationals candidate got lucky, Peter Dutton doubled down on his statements and the prime minister was clearly sick of questions about his fall.

title.children: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton double down on weak spots

image.altText: Video still of an argument at an election forum

props.synopsis: Kooyong MP Monique Ryan has condemned gatecrashers who interrupted an election forum on Wednesday night, which saw one audience member throw a punch.

title.children: Kooyong forum descends into chaos after 'right-wing bullies' gatecrash

image.altText: israeli soldiers work on their tank near the israel and gaza border

props.synopsis: The strike on a "well known" United Nations compound last month left one employee of the organisation dead and forced the UN to temporarily reduce its staffing in Gaza.

title.children: Israeli tank fire responsible for deadly strike at UN facility in Gaza

image.altText: A father stands with his arm around his young son's shoulders at war memorial.

props.synopsis: Anzac Day has always been difficult for Luke McCallum. But this year, for the first time since having his legs partially amputated, he's ready to march again.

title.children: Navy veteran overcomes suicide attack and losing his legs to march with his son

image.altText: A young, dark-haired woman wearing a dark T-shirt with "Ukraine" written on it. She stands on a narrow city street.

props.synopsis: Ukrainians living overseas have little faith that the Russians will abide by a ceasefire agreement and say their country should continue to fight regardless of whether or not the US withdraws support.

title.children: Ukrainians who fled Putin's war fear a ceasefire won't hold

image.altText: A supermarket in Darwin, surrounded by police tape.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man will face court charged with murder after the fatal stabbing of a Nightcliff grocery store owner on Wednesday.

title.children: Teen charged with murder over fatal Darwin supermarket stabbing

image.altText: A soft and chewy Anzac biscuit, which is flat and wide.

props.synopsis: Like holding a minute's silence and playing the Last Post, Anzac biscuits are a big part of the national day of remembrance for many.

title.children: Chewy or crunchy? Here's how to make Anzac biscuits

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Elephants pack their trunks, a trailblazing pope and an exchange of nice words

image.altText: Beverley Minogue

props.synopsis: A pilot program at one of Australia's biggest emergency departments halves the number of older patients admitted to hospital.

title.children: Pilot program halves number of older patients taking up emergency ward beds

image.altText: Three guides side by side

props.synopsis: Australian influencers' fitness and nutrition guides flew off the shelves in the mid-to-late 2010s, promising "bikini bodies" for the average woman. We asked the experts if their advice holds up today.

title.children: Four experts reviewed the 2010s most popular fitness guides. Here's what they said

image.altText: An older man in tinted glasses among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Starring in more than 80 shows and movies over more than 50 years, Gerard Kennedy was famed for his rugged looks and intense performances.

title.children: Two-time Gold Logie winner Gerard Kennedy dies

image.altText: Dutton election campaign Tasmania

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton said some of the 41,000 cuts would be achieved by not proceeding with unfilled vacancies, but political opponents and experts say the numbers don't add up.

title.children: Public service cuts only for Canberra, Dutton says, which Labor calls 'impossible'

image.altText: A close up of an elderly man's hands as they hold a walking stick

props.synopsis: Police alleged the 46-year-old woman sexually abused seven elderly residents at a facility in Sydney's south-west and sent recordings of the assaults to her partner.

title.children: Sydney aged care employee charged with sexual assault of residents

image.altText: Bronson Xerri and Jacob Preston stand on the field after the Bulldogs' loss to Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Bulldogs coach Cameron Ciraldo says he is equal parts "proud" and "filthy" with his team after their perfect start to the season was undone in a game that he dubbed a "ball-ache to watch".

title.children: Dogs loss Gould's favourite game this year, but coach calls it a 'ball-ache'

image.altText: A man in religious garb sitting in front of a red curtain, looking on

props.synopsis: As he glided around St Peter's Square in his Popemobile on Sunday, the fact he was 88 and had just spent several weeks in hospital somehow seemed a distant memory. Then everything changed.

title.children: 'We thought it would happen a month ago': Inside Pope Francis's final days

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The NT government has promised to urgently pass new bail laws to bring the territory in-line with Victoria and NSW in the wake of a fatal stabbing of a local Darwin grocer.

title.children: Bail reform promised in wake of NT supermarket stabbing

image.altText: Men in white suits are bent over and marched through a brightly lit prison.

props.synopsis: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was sent to a brutal prison in El Salvador, even though the migrant living in the United States had never been convicted of a crime.  Now, Donald Trump is refusing to follow a Supreme Court order.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Why Trump's found an ally in El Salvador's ‘dictator’

image.altText: A mid shot of Lisa Govan posing for a photo smiling with her arms around a large dog while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: A WA coroner indicates he'll be unable to determine how a woman died after she disappeared in Kalgoorlie more than 25 years ago.

title.children: Gang member breaks silence on woman missing from bikie clubhouse

image.altText: A young man in a suit and a pink head wrap.

props.synopsis: NSW Police were called to a car park shortly before midnight and found 18-year-old Ekampreet Sahni Singh with a gunshot wound.

title.children: Teen shot dead in Newcastle car park a 'lovely kid', friends say

image.altText: A storm cloud approaching land on an autumn afternoon

props.synopsis: From showers in the east to a chilly dawn service in the west, this is the Anzac Day weather forecast across Australia.

title.children: Parts of Australia's east set to be soaked this Anzac Day

image.altText: Body worn camera vision of the fire police were confronted with in Albany.

props.synopsis: A man who set fire to a home when children were inside while experiencing a meth-induced psychosis is sentenced to eight years in prison.

title.children: Man jailed for lighting house on fire with children inside during meth-induced psychosis

image.altText: woman

props.synopsis: A mother and son convicted of murdering an Indigenous teen in Nowra have been told by victim's family of the grief caused by the "revenge attack".

title.children: 'Forever coward murderers' confronted by hit-and-run victim's family

image.altText: A graphic showing a row of chairs and signage that says 'Medicare' and 'bulk billing availabel'

props.synopsis: Two new surveys have cast doubt on whether the signature health policy of this election campaign can be delivered.

title.children: We've been promised more bulk-billing, but doctors say they can't deliver

image.altText: A detail of an old photograph showing returned soldiers

props.synopsis: A Queensland historian has researched the stories of Australia's military "rejects" and how they made vital contributions to World War I efforts.

title.children: How the 'rejects' from WWI refused to be cast aside

image.altText: A graphic image with a woman (the coroner) and a man (Rolfe) in greyscale, in front of a blue background with hand prints.

props.synopsis: The coroner's findings into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, an Aboriginal man shot by a Northern Territory police officer in 2019, will be handed down on June 10, 2025. It comes after a series of delays that made the coronial inquiry the longest-running and most expensive in the territory's history.

title.children: NT coroner to deliver findings into police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker

image.altText: The scene of the car crash on Canberra Avenue near Burke Crescent in Griffith.

props.synopsis: Charges against a man accused of hitting two St Edmund's College students with an allegedly stolen car as they crossed the road to school last month are to be upgraded to culpable driving causing grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Man accused of hitting Canberra schoolboys with car has charges upgraded

image.altText: an aerial photo of a gold mine.

props.synopsis: A Canadian-owned mining company has pleaded guilty to sacred site damage after accidentally tipping off the regulator about its unlawful drilling at a Northern Territory sacred site.

title.children: Gold miner accidentally reveals sacred site drilling in press release

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, there is now a conversation about an organisation called Atlas Network and whether or not it has influenced the right-bloc government's agenda.

title.children: Growing questions in NZ about organisation called Atlas Network

image.altText: An older man wearing glasses with grey hair delivering a speech at a conference table, looking stern.

props.synopsis: The President of the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank has demanded the militant group free the remaining 59 Israeli hostages held in Gaza and hand over its weapons.

title.children: 'You sons of dogs': Palestinian leader blasts Hamas in hostage release demand

image.altText: a man in a suit

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say Moon Jae-in has been indicted for alleged bribery over the employment of his former son-in-law at a Thai airline.

title.children: Prosecutors indict former South Korean president Moon Jae-in for bribery
